parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being electoral propaganda, it suggests it might not be officially sanctioned campaign material.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post refers to Raluca Giorgiana Dumitrescu, who is identified as a PSD deputy in Ialomița County.  The link provided leads to the Romanian Chamber of Deputies website, further reinforcing the connection to her political role. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide audience in Ialomița County, Romania.  The reach estimate is 100K-500K, clearly indicating an attempt to reach a large segment of the population. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's objective is ambiguous. While it doesn't explicitly call for votes, the association with a PSD deputy and the link to her official parliamentary profile strongly suggests an intention to enhance her public image and indirectly influence voters' perception of her. The image, if present and showing her in a positive light, would further strengthen this interpretation.  This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic content. It lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected from journalistic reporting. The link to the Chamber of Deputies website is not presented as a news item but rather as a means to associate the candidate with her official role.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post does not express a personal opinion; instead, it promotes the candidate's official profile and implicitly her political affiliation.  It's not a personal statement but a carefully crafted advertisement.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1120928716120960</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while not explicitly calling for votes, uses paid advertising on a public platform to associate Raluca Giorgiana Dumitrescu with her official role as a PSD deputy. The targeting of a large audience in Ialomița County, combined with the link to her official profile, strongly suggests an intention to influence voters' perception and indirectly promote her candidacy.  The absence of a CMF number is a mitigating factor, but the overall context points towards electoral propaganda.  The end date of the ad (1732867200) needs to be checked against the official end date of the electoral campaign to determine if it violates the timeframe specified in Article 98 t).
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>RALUCA GIORGIANA DUMITRESCU</name>
    <impact>POSITIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PSD</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Raluca Giorgiana Dumitrescu, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul postării 1120928716120960, care promovează imaginea sa pozitivă ca deputat PSD în județul Ialomița, având un buget de sub 100 RON,  ajungând la 25.000-30.000 de impresii, cu o estimare a audienței de 100.000-500.000 de persoane,  și un link către profilul său oficial de pe site-ul Camerei Deputaților,  având drept efect electoral influențarea percepției electoratului asupra candidaturii sale.  Această postare, deși nu solicită explicit voturi, constituie propagandă electorală prin asocierea imaginii sale cu funcția sa politică, încalcând prevederile legale privind perioada de campanie electorală.  Contactul reclamantei este dumitrescuralucagiorgiana1@gmail.com și +40727704373.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
